#summary Creating GERBER-274-X files for PCB fabrication in KiCAD

After finishing your project you must set up KiCAD to produce well-defined [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerber_File Gerber] files.  Select _Tracks and Vias_ from the _Dimensions Menu_.  Now change the *Mask Clearance* from `0.001` to `0.0001` and click _OK_.

  http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Tutorial-PlottingGerbers-1.jpg

Now create the Gerber files.  Select _Plot_ from the _File_ menu.  Check the `Exclude Edges_Pcb layer` checkbox to keep other layers clean.  Select all the layers you want to plot.  Here is a quick list of the layers usually needed:

|| *KiCAD Layer Name* || *Gerber Name*        || *Gerber Extension* ||
|| Copper             || Bottom Layer         || `.GBL`             ||
|| Component          || Top Layer            || `.GTL`             ||
|| !SoldP_Cmp         || Top Paste            || `.GTP`             ||
|| !SilkS_Cmp         || Top Overlay          || `.GTO`             ||
|| !Mask_Cop          || Bottom Solder Resist || `.GBS`             ||
|| !Mask_Cmp          || Top Solder Resist    || `.GTS`             ||
|| !Edges_Pcb         || Edges                || N/A                ||

  http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Tutorial-PlottingGerbers-2.jpg

Click _Plot_ to create the selected layers in the same directory as your project files.  Note that KiCAD creates all Gerber files with the extension `.pho`.

  http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Tutorial-PlottingGerbers-4.jpg

Now click the _Generate Drill File_ button to create the drill file.  Your PCB fabricator may have specific requirements for these settings.  The options selected in the picture below are somewhat standard.

  http://opendous.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/Pictures/KiCAD_Tutorial-PlottingGerbers-3.jpg

Click _OK_ button to generate the drill file.  Click _Close_ in the *Plot* window to close.  You are done.
